name: wikidocs
description: WikiDocs is a self-hosted documentation and knowledge base system built around markdown files. It provides navigation, search, and clean page rendering, making it easy to publish internal or project documentation as a web site.
features: Markdown-based: Write documentation using markdown files stored in a simple folder structure.
Automatic navigation: Generate navigation menus automatically from folder and file organization.
Search capability: Find documentation quickly with built-in full-text search across all pages.
Syntax highlighting: Display code examples with proper syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages.
Responsive layout: Access documentation on any device with a mobile-friendly responsive design.
No database required: Run without external dependencies using file-based storage for simplicity.
Custom branding: Personalize the appearance with logos, colors, and custom CSS.
Table of contents: Automatically generate page-level table of contents from markdown headings.
Image support: Embed images and diagrams directly in documentation pages.
Version control friendly: Store documentation in Git for collaborative editing and version tracking.
Quick deployment: Set up documentation sites in minutes with minimal configuration.
Lightweight footprint: Run on minimal server resources suitable for small VPS or shared hosting.
